questionTitle: Which of the following mobile platform support hundreds of thousands of third-party applications?
questionExplanation: The five major smartphone operating systems to consider are Google’s Android, Apple’s iOS (iPhone OS), RIM BlackBerry, Symbian, and Windows Mobile Phone.

questionOption1: Cloud services are having a major impact on cellular phone technology, and vice versa
questionOption2: Very few smartphones come with native applications that consume Web services
questionOption3: Mobile application developers are staging their apps in the cloud, and a number of hosting services provide support for this
questionExplanation: Many smartphones come with native applications that consume Web services.

questionTitle: In which of the following computing, mobile device serves as the presentation platform or the display?
questionExplanation: Most of the computing applications that run on mobile devices run on the local device itself, with a few exceptions.

questionTitle: Which of the following applications are processed locally on the phone?
questionExplanation: Smartphones are essentially miniaturized computers that run locally.

questionOption1: When you develop an application for the cloud, you need multiple type of developer and then all the connected phones can use that application
questionOption2: When you develop an application for the cloud, you need just one of developer and then all the connected phones can use that application
questionOption3: The codec that compresses the video content uses a block-oriented motion-compensation scheme
questionExplanation: This is one of the main reasons why cloud computing represents a disruptive technology for mobile computing and cell phones.

questionTitle: Mobile Lite is an extension of the __________ cloud service.
questionExplanation: Salesforce.com’s Mobile Lite illustrates an important trend in software to extend its products as cloud services for mobile access.

questionTitle: ________ is slated to add both the Opera Mini 5 and Opera Mobile 10 browsers to the Brew mobile platform.
questionExplanation: There’s little uniformity in the features and interoperability in the micro-browser arena, but that could change quickly.

questionTitle: Which of the following are essential characteristics of smartphone in cloud?
questionOption1: A smartphone offers advanced calling features such as video calls or conferencing
questionOption2: A smartphone has a recognizable operating system
questionOption3: A smartphone comes with a touchscreen
questionExplanation: Smartphones are small computers on which you can make phone calls, send messages, and access Internet data in real time.

questionTitle: Which of the following factors needs to be considered while moving from smartphone execution to a virtual machine running in the cloud?
questionExplanation:
If you move smartphone execution to a virtual machine running in the cloud, smartphones are no longer constrained by their
processing power, memory, or storage capacity.

questionTitle: Which of the following was built to serve as a mobile platform for Internet computing?
questionExplanation: The Android software is based on Java and runs in a Dalvik virtual machine.
